In Lebanon, millions are fleeing for their lives and thousands are being blown to pieces in a repeat of the first phase of the genocide in Gaza. For Israel's leaders, every person killed or forced to flee and every demolished building in a neighboring country opens the way for future Israeli settlements. The people of Iran, Syria, Iraq, Jordan, Egypt and Saudi Arabia ask themselves which of them will be next.

Israel is especially threatened when the governments of the world come together at the United Nations and in international courts to try to enforce the rule of international law, under which Israel is legally bound by the same rules that all countries have signed up to in the UN Charter and the Geneva Conventions.

In September, the UN General'Assembly passed a resolution giving Israel one year to complete that withdrawal. sub_questions.explanation:
(a) attack; (b) restless/unstable; (c) defy/ neglect/violate; (d) countries/nations;
(e) forced/ compelled.

questions.uddipok:
Write a paragraph on 'Drug Addiction' answering the following questions in 200 words.
a) What is drug addiction? b) What are the causes of drug adiction? c) How does it affect young generation? d) Why should young generation have knowledge on drug addiction? e) How can we rid of drug addiction?

sub_questions.explanation:
Drug Addiction
A drug is usually used as a medicine to cure diseases. But sometimes it is taken by some people as a habit to get amusement or relief from pain. This habit of taking the harmful drug is called drug addiction. Drug addiction is a curse of modern civilization. Nowadays, it has become a global problem. Drug addiction has grasped the young generation in our country. The people who take the drug cannot stop taking it. There are some reasons behind this addiction. Some take drugs to forget their painful past or present. Some take drugs in pursuit of pleasure. Some people, at first, take a drug as fun but afterwards, it turns into an addiction for them. The aftereffects of drug addiction are very harmful and serious. The health of the addicts breaks down. They lose their mental and physical power. They lose their social status and the love of their nearer and dearer ones as well. Everybody dislikes or hates them. Various kinds of diseases attack them. They suffer from amnesia, insomnia, nausea, physical weakness, blood pressure and from many other critical diseases. Their lungs, kidneys and livers are also damaged. Drugs are very expensive. So, the addicts often go for stealing, hijacking, killing and all sorts of misdeeds to manage money. For this reason, it should be stopped at any cost. Addiction to drugs can be checked by creating social awareness. The mass media can play an effective role in this regard. Seminars, discussions and debates should be held in schools, colleges and universities now and then. The government alone cannot solve this problem. People must cooperate with it. Above all, the rules of religion can play the most important role.

questions.uddipok:
Read the following story. It is incomplete. Complete it with at least 10 new sentences and give it a title.
There was a wicked boy living in a village near a forest. He used to often cry out "Tiger! Tiger!!" to make fun. But believing him, the villagers would come to help him………..

sub_questions.explanation:
A Liar Shepherd
There was a shepherd boy. He kept a flock of sheep near a forest. It was not far from his village. One day, he wanted to make a fun with the villagers. So, he began to shout, "Wolf! Wolf! Help! Help!" The villagers heard his cry and ran to help him. When they came near him, they found no wolf there and the boy laughed at them. The villagers were fooled by the cunning boy and hence, they went away. After a few days, he made the same fun and the villagers came again to help him but found no wolf there. One day, a wolf really came and it attacked the flock of sheep. The boy somehow climbed up a tree and shouted for help. The villagers heard him but they thought that it was his another fun and no one came to help him. The wolf killed one of his sheep and took it away. The boy felt sorry for his silly joke. From then, he promised not to tell a lie and befool people again.

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Nadim/Nadia, you have a friend named Fahim/Fahima who does not read newspaper. Now, write a dialogue between you and your friend about the importance of reading newspaper.

sub_questions.explanation:
Nadim : Hi, Fahim? How're you?

Fahim : Fine, thanks. What're you doing?

Nadim : I'm reading a newspaper. Will you take a page?

Fahim : No, thanks. I don't read newspaper.

Nadim : What! It's really surprising!

Fahim : Why? What's the importance of reading newspaper?

Nadim : Well. Newspaper is a collection of current affairs of the world. Without reading it, you're like a frog in a dark well. Do you know what are the burning issues of our country now? Or, what's going on in our neighbouring countries?

Fahim : Really not.

Nadim : But I know, because I read newspapers regularly. Newspapers can provide you with the news of the home and abroad. It's especially important for the students as it's the best medium of enriching our general knowledge. For this, it's called the storehouse of knowledge.

Fahim : You're right.

Nadim : Newspaper can make you introduce to the culture and customs of different countries of the world. You can know some such important information which are applicable to your practical life.

Fahim : You've opened my eyes. Now, I can feel the necessity of reading newspapers. Really, I'm detached from the current world. But I promise, I'll build up the
habit of reading newspaper from today. Thank you very much.

Nadim : You're most welcome.

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Tabib and your friend is Rohan. Now, write a dialogue between you and your friend about how to develop leàdership qualities.

sub_questions.explanation:
Tabib : Hi Rohan, I've been thinking about how to improve my leadership skills. Any ideas?
Rohan : Definitely, Tabib. You can start with developing good communication skills. Being able to convey your thoughts, clearly and listen to others is the key.
Tabib : That makes sense. What else?
Rohan : Taking on responsibilities is important too. You can start the practice at home. Besides, try to be a reliable volunteer for projects or tasks that challenge you. It helps build confidence and experience.
Tabib : So, stepping out of my comfort zone is crucial. Got it. What about decisionmaking?
Rohan : Yes, making decisions and taking ownership is vital. It shows you're willing to lead and handle the consequences.
Tabib : How about teamwork?
Rohan : Absolutely. Working well with others and understanding team dynamics is essential. A good leader supports and motivates his/her team.
Tabib : I see. Any tips on handling conflicts?
Rohan : Stay calm and objective. Focus on resolving the issue, not on 'who's right or wrong'. Effective conflict resolution can earn you respect.
Tabib : These are great points, Rohan. Anything else?
Rohan : Always keep learning. Read books, attend workshops, and seek feedback. Continuous improvement is the mark of a true leader.
Tabib : Thanks, Rohan! I feel more confident about developing my leadership skills now.
Rohan : Anytime, Tabib. Just remember, leadership is a journey, not a destination.
